detailsOfAchievement: Heart for Art is a Public Charitable Trust that promotes the traditional Arts + Crafts of India. We at Heart for Art, work towards bringing you products from the best artisans of India, who passionately create them! We create partnerships to find space for art and craft in private and public spaces and help craftsmen get back their pride and improve their living conditions. Our endeavor is to provide these products in the best traditions of artisanal masterpieces, yet adapted to contemporary lifestyles and sensibilities. Heart for Art products represent some of the best traditions of Kashmiri, Bidriware, Dhokra, Kottan, Channapatna, Navalgund, Longpi, Jaipur and many other Indian arts and crafts. We also conduct lots of workshops with artisans and help them sell their products in Pune, mumbai, Bengaluru etc. We participate in exhibtions to showcase artisans products in various places. Also we help the artists with commissioned works in corporates and institutes.

detailsOfAchievement: I.V.K. Rajwade Sanshodhan Mandal Dhule established in 9th jan. 1927 to carry forward the work of great historian V.K. Rajwade who honored by govt. of India by issuing commemorative postage stamp and information brochure in 2003. The importance of publication of the institution is related to history based on original documents. More than 2 laks historical documents available in archival and increasing it regularly. Since establishment institution published more than 100 books some of now out of print on heavy demand of scholars of India and abroad. These books are very important for the graduate, post graduate, M.Phil, PhD, D.lit level. Just 14 books publication ceremony was held at Dhule in the presence of honorable former precedent Smt. Pratibhatai Patil.

detailsOfAchievement: ICID strives to empower the vulnerable and weaker sections of the society and enable them to lead a dignified life. ICID promotes integral human growth through services to the needy and vulnerable in the society. The present focus of the organization is on the integral development of children with a special emphasis on the children in difficult situation who need special care and protection. It aims to create awareness among the street children on various social issues that affect them, to enable the children to access better health care and services and to promote child rights especially of survival, development and participation. The organization organizes various programs on health, hygiene, education, values and human rights with a special focus on children. â€¢ Yuvajyothi Care and Support centre provides basic facilities and mainstreams them through constant care, acceptance and special supportive environment. The centre is unique in its nature as it is located in a community which enables the children to interact with their peers as well as the elders in the community and be positively influenced. Over 500 children have accessed facilities till date. â€¢ Nirmal Jyothi Program is implemented at Gittikhadan among children in beggary and rag picking for a dignified living. Approximately 170 children access basic facilities, non formal education, recreational activities and 65 children are involved in small saving through bank accounts. Hygiene education, tuition classes, vocational training such as beauty culture, tailoring, embroidery and craft has been initiated are part of the program. â€¢ Asha Program include non formal education and capacity building of children from slum community. A centre is established at Hazaripahad where about 40 adolescent girls from slum communities are trained in embroidery, beauty culture, craft and tailoring. The Balwadi (kindergarten) focuses on the development of young children and prepare them for schooling. A playroom and a library has been provided at the centre. â€¢ Deepshika Program is implemented in Tulsi Nagar, near the dumping yard in Lakhad Ganj Zone of Nagpur city with the children in rag picking. The programme includes hygiene and life skill education for adolescents. The balwadi and toy centre prepares the pre school children for schooling and divert their attention from rag picking. Over 100 children benefit from the programme. â€¢ Regular summer camps on life skills are organized with the objective of building self confidence and providing opportunities for creative expression in children aged between 8-16 years from slum communities. Over 300 children participate in different camps every year. â€¢ Janya â€“ A project for reducing vulnerability towards HIV/AIDS and building life skills among the children in difficult situation supported by Avert Society Mumbai: 3021 children were given right information on Human Sexuality, STI, HIV/AIDS, 808 children were equipped with adequate life skills, 837 children in High Risk Behaviour were provided counselling, 3308 significant others were sensitized, more than 400 children participated in Bal Melas.

title: INDIAN CENTRE FOR PLASTICS IN THE ENVIRONMENT
detailsOfAchievement: ICPE was set up in 1999 on the recommendation of a Task Force constituted by MoEF to handle Environmental, Social and Technical issues of plastics and plastics waste in the country. Major Activities and Achievements are given below. Successfully implemented Model Projects on Segregation of Dry Waste at source in some Wards of Mumbai. In 2015, 5000 MTs of Dry Waste was collected and segregated for recycling by 125 waste pickers who earned Rs. 3.1 Crores by selling the waste to the recyclers. Successfully implemented Domestic Solid Waste Management system at a residential colony in New Delhi by setting up composting and energy pellate making plants. Non-recyclable plastics waste is converted to LDO range fuel by Pyrolysis Plant. No Waste from the colony goes to landfill. Successful implementation of compacting of PET bottle waste collected from rail tracks of Mumbai into bales for transportation to recyclers in 2002 resulted in resolving PET Bottle waste management issue in the city. In 2001, resolved the plastics waste management problem faced by eco sensitive hill station - Matheran near Mumbai. ICPE has undertaken Plastics Waste Management Programmes at various other locations namely Mahabaleshwar, Tirupathi, Ward 82 of Kolkata Corporation, New Delhi and Jhansi. In 2008 ICPE jointly with cement major ACC Ltd and in the presence of Madhya Pradesh Pollution Control Board for the first time in India demonstrated and established safe co processing of all types of plastics waste in cement kilns. ICPE has developed its own technology and constructed a public road using plastics waste in Dadar, Mumbai in 2008. Subsequently, roads were constructed in other locations near Kolkata, Delhi and Baroda. ICPE technology was shared freely with the road engineers of different States. This helped in popularising the concept of using plastics waste in bitumen roads without infringing the patent rights of other Technologies. ICPE in co-operation with local Associations conducts awareness programmes widely across the country, mainly in schools, educational institutes and local communities. The areas include Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai, Hyderabad, Ahmedabad, Baroda, Chandigarh, Patna, Kolhapur, Nanded, Matheran, Mahabaleshwar and Panchgani. ICPE had also sponsored such programmes at other locations. About 10 Lakhs students were directly covered. Awareness Booklets were printed and short video films were produced in major Indian languages and distributed among school students. ICPE sponsored scientific Research and Study Reports on Plastics in the Environment conducted by premier Institutions have been published. Subjects covered are LCA, Plastics in Food Packaging and Plastics in Health Care and Safety etc. This information helps clearing various Myths about Plastics. All information is uploaded in well designed and maintained ICPE ENVIS website for dissemination. ICPE is recognised by MoEF and BIS as an Expert Body in the field of Plastics in the Environment and Plastics Waste Management. Government Departments often take ICPE assistance in drafting replies to Parliamentary questions on plastics.

detailsOfAchievement: Indian Drug Manufacturers Association (IDMA) was formed in 1961 and successfully completed 54 glorious years having membership of over 900 wholly Indian Large, Medium and Small Companies (Formulations & APIs) and State Boards in Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh & Uttarakhand, Haryana, Tamil Nadu, Kerala & Puducherry, West Bengal, Madhya Pradesh, Telengana and Karnataka. Presented a White Paper on Journey Towards Pharma Vision 2020 And Beyond to the Government of India. Indian pharma industry has grown exponentially from 10 crore in 1948 to over 2,45,000 crore today with our members domestic market share almost 75% in Formulations and 85% in APIs. Exports of about 1,15,600 crore in FY 2015-16 with our members share almost 65%. MoUs signed with China Pharmaceutical Industry Association (CPIA), Korea Pharmaceutical Industry Association (KPMA), DuBiotech, Association of Biotechnology Led Enterprises (ABLE) and Toyoma Pharmaceutical Association (TPA) etc. 70 plus member companies have over 200 USFDA approved facilities. IDMA has been successfully organizing Pharmaceutical Analysts Convention (PAC), our Flagship event for over 19 years with the active participation of National & International Regulatory Authorities. IDMA also, organizes other Seminars, Training Programs & Workshops on various other verticals. IDMA and Department of Pharmaceuticals, Government of India are jointly conducting series of GMP Workshops for SMEs on Schedule M and Beyond For Global Quality and Compliance all over India. IDMA Representations on Government Committees: Ministry of Health & Family Welfares Committee for examining and recommending amendments in the Drugs and Cosmetics Rules, 1945. Member of the Governing Body of Life Sciences Sector Skill Development Council (LSSSDC), New Delhi. PMâ€™s Task Force on Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs). Ministry of Labour & Employment - constitution of Industrial Tri-partite Committee for Sales Promotion Employees. DCG(I) Screening Committee to examine the contentious Fixed Dose Combinations. Indian Pharmacopoeia Working Group. PMOs Task Force on Pharmaceutical & Knowledge based industries. Committee set up by Planning Commission for issue of FDI in existing Indian Pharmaceutical Companies. Ministry of Healths Committee to suggest remedial measures to combat menace of spurious drugs. National Working Group on Patent Laws (NWGPL). FICCI Pharmaceutical Committee. CII Pharmaceutical Committee. Minimum Wages Advisory Board, Assam. IDMA PUBLICATIONS: IDMA Bulletin a weekly since last 47 years. Indian Drugs a monthly scientific and technical journal since last 53 years and available online. IDMA Annual Publication a reference compendium which contains a wealth of information and data on the Indian Pharmaceutical Industry. Technical Monographs Guidelines on standards in manufacturing. IDMA ANNUAL AWARDS: IDMA QUALITY EXCELLENCE AWARDS for Bulk Drug and Formulation manufacturing units. IDMA MARGI BEST PATENT AWARD for Best patents granted in India and outside. IDMA RESEARCH AWARDS and the BEST REVIEW ARTICLE AWARD for the Best Original Research Papers and Review Article published in Indian Drugs IDMA J B MODY AWARDS for the top-ranking B. Pharm students of Indian Universities IDMA-APA EMINENT ANALYST AWARD - in recognition of life-time contribution and expertise in the field of Quality Assurance/Quality Control. IDMA-APA OUTSTANDING AND YOUNG ANALYST AWARDS to encourage and promote young professional analysts.

This is Fab Lab O ie first fab lab in the global network of Fab Lab Our center Vigyan Ashram at Pabal is vocational Training Provider with various sectors skills councils and accredited vocational institute of NIOS Our center Vigyan Ashram, have received several award including Maharashtra State Rural Livelihood Innovation Forum award, Development Marketplace award by World bank and others We have developed several technologies and commercialized them. Details are on our website www.vigyanashram.com Our center in village Pabal, Vigyan Ashram is working on issues of rural development and try to address them through education system. To do this we are working on development of appropriate technologies, skills training on rural youth and helping them to establish their own enterprises. In technology development our focus is on precision agriculture, agricultural tools and machinery, digital fabrication, renewal energy solution and water and waste management. We are making efforts to develop alternatives to address problems of quality of school education. Our focus is on STEAM education Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Mathematics. The Centre for Educational Studie The Indian Institute of Education, Pune was founded by J.P. Naik (1907 to 1981), humanist, freedom fighter, polymath, encyclopedic thinker and socialist educationist. Recognized by the UNESCO alongside Rabindranath Tagore and Mahatma Gandhi as three pioneering educationists, J.P. Naik is also known as an institution maker. After his death, the mission of the Indian Institute of Education was taken by his wife Chitra Naik (1918 to 2010) who continued his philosophy of decolonization of knowledge with her praxis of challenging educational orthodoxy. Presently the institution is working on interdisciplinary aspects of social sciences. Health studies, minority studies, tribal studies and studies in inclusive education are the leitmotivs of teaching, research and pedagogy The Centre for Educational Studies is recognized by the University of Pune as a Permanently Recognized Research Institute under section 46 of the Pune University Act 1974 for conducting M.Phil and PhD programmes in Education Interdisciplinary. The objectives of the programme offered by the Centre are To create a pool of researchers trained to analyze, plan, manage and improve education To deal with path breaking scientific research and knowledge production in the areas of education and the social sciences To strengthen and further evolve methodologies of educational research for creating rational foundations for reviews and formulation of educational policies, plans and action programmers
